alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 6:41PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, St. Clair. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pell City, Harrisburg, Logan Martin Lake, Cropwell, St. Clair County Airport, Chula Vista and Wattsville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
